sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten postcard from Harden to Schenker, dated February 16, 1894
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Harden asks for Schenker’s permission to put off publishing Schenker’s article on prominent conductors until Harden himself writes something personal about Hans von Bülow [who had died four days earlier].
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Harden, Maximilian; Schenker, Heinrich; conductors; Bülow, Hans von

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten postcard from Harden to Schenker, dated February 16, 1894

tei:transcription.tei:p: {recto} [preprinted form with handwritten address] Deutsche Reichspost Postkarte
An [/] Herrn Dr. H. Schenker in Wien Wohnung III Fraungasse 1.

ich möchte, wenn ich irgend dazu komme, zuerst einiges Persönliche über Bülow Click on Hans von Bülow. Bülow had died on February 12, 1894, four days before the date of this postcard; he was a personal acquaintance of Harden’s. schreiben, u. dann Ihren Artikel über die Dirigenten This would eventually be published as “Konzertdirigenten” in Die Zukunft on April 14, 1894. It is reprinted in Hellmut Federhofer, Heinrich Schenker als Essayist und Kritiker (Hildesheim: Georg Olms Verlag, 1990), pp. 75–82. bringen. Hoffentlich paßts Ihnen so.
Mit verbindt. Dank und den besten Grüßen Ihr erg. [signed:] Harden 16./2.94

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten postcard from Harden to Schenker, dated February 16, 1894

tei:translation.tei:p: {recto} [preprinted form with handwritten address] German Imperial Post Postcard
To Dr. H. Schenker in Vienna Address III Fraungasse 1.
I would like, if I can somehow get to it, first to write something personal about Bülow, and then to publish your article on the conductors. I hope this meets with your approval.
With collegial thanks and best wishes, Yours truly, [signed:] Harden
